page.title: 02FARMING 1.
page.content: 75% of the area is given over to Farming - this is good agricultural land. The New Town was built on the only poor quality land in the area. Mixed Farming was traditional making the local communities self sufficient providing grain, vegetables, meat, poultry, dairy produce for themselves and the townships of Wigan, St.Helens and Ormskirk. The farms employed many people but mainly on a seasonal basis. Everyone in the local community worked on the farms at harvest time and upto quite recently the Village Schools were closed for 2 weeks in October for the 'Potato Picking Holiday'. This produced a strong sense of community. The advent of the tractor and other machinery brought less reliance on the community and the emerging food industry changed the pattern of farming
